10 things someone with ADD can do each morning to have a more productive day:

1. Create a to-do list: Writing down tasks and prioritizing them can help minimize distractions and keep focus on what is important.
2. Active meditation: Take 10-15 minutes for deep breathing exercises, yoga, or a quick jog to mentally prepare for the day ahead.
3. Eat a nutritious breakfast: A balanced meal will not only provide energy but also improve focus and concentration.
4. Set specific goals: Assigning specific time blocks to tasks will eliminate the need to decide what to do next and give a sense of accomplishment as tasks are completed.
5. Use visualization: Take a minute each morning to visualize a productive day, and mentally picture yourself successfully completing tasks.
6. Avoid multitasking: While it may seem efficient, multitasking can quickly lead to distraction and decrease overall productivity. Focus on completing one task at a time and taking short breaks as needed.
7. Recognize your triggers: Identify the situations and behaviors that lead to distractions and implement strategies to avoid them.
8. Recognize & reduce system overwhelm: Finding a productivity system that works for you can take time and experimentation.
9. Stay organized: Keep a tidy workspace, develop an organization system for documents, and ensure tasks and deadlines are clearly marked on a calendar or planner.
10. Create a to-do list the night before: This will provide structure and clarity to their day and help them to stay organized and focused.

Each main item can be summarized as follows:

1. Create a to-do list:
* Break down the list into smaller chunks
* Prioritize individual tasks
* Set a timer or timer reminders
* Use a daily schedule or to-do list
* Take regular breaks
2. Active meditation:
* Take 10-15 minutes for deep breathing exercises, yoga, or a quick jog
* Listen to calming music or drink caffeine
* Increase focus levels
* Help maintain energy and focus throughout the day
* Improve mental preparation for the day ahead
3. Eat a nutritious breakfast:
* Provide energy and focus throughout the day
* Eat a balanced breakfast with protein, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates
* Good breakfast options include oatmeal, eggs, whole grain toast, yogurt, and smoothies
* Maintain focus and provide energy until the next meal
* Improve focus and concentration
4. Set specific goals:
* Create a daily schedule or to-do list
* Set timer reminders
* Take regular breaks
* Break down big projects into smaller tasks
* Reward yourself for completing tasks
5. Use visualization:
* Take a minute each morning to visualize a productive day
* Mentally picture yourself successfully completing tasks
* Stay motivated and help achieve goals
* Build confidence and give a better sense of control over the day
* Help to focus and set up for success each day
6. Avoid multitasking:
* Focus on completing one task at a time
* Take short breaks as needed
* Close windows and apps, put phones away, and turn off notifications
* Reduce distractions
* Stay focused and on-task
7. Recognize your triggers:
* Identify the situations and behaviors that lead to distractions
* Keep a journal
* Analyze the situation objectively
* Recognize patterns
* Be better prepared for future distractions
8. Recognize & reduce system overwhelm:
* Assess different systems tried
* Determine what was useful from each system
* Create a customized system that works best for you
* Remain flexible and willing to make changes as needed
* Determine what did and didn’t work in any particular productivity system

* Keep a tidy workspace
* Develop an organization system for documents
